item.title: Dangerous Parking, 11th November
item.description:
I am writing to request the installation of white parking bay markings (parking boxes) outside my property on 45 and 47 The Drive. Currently, there are no parking boxes on this section of the road, even though it is located on a bend. This lack of markings is creating a significant safety issue for both residents and passing traffic. Because vehicles and vans have to park in the road, only one lane of traffic can pass at a time. This often leads to situations where drivers approaching from opposite directions cannot see each other clearly around the bend, resulting in near misses and frequent emergency braking. There have also been several instances of road rage between drivers unsure of who has priority. I am concerned that without clear parking bays to guide where vehicles should safely park, there is an increased risk of a serious accident or head-on collision. I also find it puzzling that marked parking boxes have been installed on the straight sections of The Drive, where visibility is much better, but not on this clearly more hazardous bend. I would be very grateful if the council could assess this location and install white parking boxes to improve safety for residents, drivers, and pedestrians alike.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, The Drive, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
